lexUnit.name: ecstatic.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: feeling great feelings of happiness and joy

sentence.text: ` Cool it , Steve , and tell me why you 're so ecstatic .
One could get terribly ecstatic but that would be a dangerous thing to do .
But some of the younger dons were ecstatic about the election .
Morrissey was ecstatic at the response .
That morning I was so ecstatic about my triumph in seducing the dog-owner 's daughter that I 'd completely forgotten about Jamila 's big decision .
When she was ecstatic , and she was often ecstatic , ecstasy flew from her face like the sun from a mirror .
I am ecstatic about this , it is like winning my first cap not my 23rd . "
If you use a fax card you 'll be ecstatic to see that WordStar has the capacity to create faxable files in a matter of seconds .
With a grimace , Donal murmured gloomily , ` He was n't exactly ecstatic at my explanation . "
Afterwards , he was quietly ecstatic .
Minute shards of glass slashed across Rohmer 's ecstatic face .
But he was confronted by an ecstatic welcome from his mother , who was waiting for him on the doorstep .
I would n't say she gives me an ecstatic welcome .
Thank you , thank you ! " she cried , quite ecstatic that he 'd unbent .
` Well ? " he barked , clearly not ecstatic that she thought she could lay down conditions .
Every time they got near him , he backed off , ecstatic with excitement , tail wagging furiously .
No speeches have yet been greeted with ecstatic cries of ` author , author " -- probably because Denis Healey is not there -- but the clash of rival socialist philosophies is no less cacaphonous .
More then 40,000 ecstatic fans filled stadia each night to scream at the girly they instantly dubbed the Mighty Minogue .
In March they were received as World Champions by an ecstatic crowd after winning the Cricket World Cup for the first time .
She could not convince me at the time that anything bad could happen , now that I had finally ` solved " my eating problems , and for a short time I felt jubilant , relieved and ecstatic .
Her expression became dreamy , ecstatic .

Riot police were needed to quell pitch invasions. -- More than 200,000 ecstatic Leeds United fans took part in a carnival-style street party yesterday as their team paraded the League Championship trophy .
